high_risk_items.description: The RFP requires compliance with numerous State, Federal, and Local Laws, including ADA, Title VII, ADEA, and Civil Rights Act of 1991. Failure to comply with any of these could result in legal action and penalties.
high_risk_items.mitigation: Ensure comprehensive legal review of internal practices and compliance programs. Conduct regular training for all staff on relevant laws and regulations. Implement a system for tracking and documenting compliance efforts.

high_risk_items.description: The RFP includes broad indemnification clauses (Section 10.13). RFQXpert agrees to indemnify and hold harmless MHMR from a variety of claims, including those arising from negligent or wrongful acts, which could lead to significant financial exposure.
high_risk_items.mitigation: Carefully review the indemnification clauses with legal counsel. Negotiate to limit the scope of indemnification to the extent possible, ensuring it aligns with RFQXpert's level of control and responsibility. Ensure adequate insurance coverage to address potential liabilities. Develop internal controls to minimize exposure to negligent acts.

high_risk_items.description: The RFP states MHMR reserves the right to decline services of any temporary worker, with or without cause. This places the burden on RFQXpert to manage potentially unused employee hours and unexpected costs.
high_risk_items.mitigation: Develop a robust candidate screening process to ensure high suitability. Maintain open communication with MHMR to understand their evolving needs and preferences. Establish a clear policy for managing worker assignments and potential reassignments. Negotiate a minimum guarantee of hours if possible.

medium_risk_items.description: The RFP stipulates that MHMR will not reimburse mileage or parking (Section 4.1.5). This may impact the profitability of the contract depending on the assignment locations and employee travel costs.
medium_risk_items.mitigation: Factor travel costs into the proposed hourly rates. Explore options for employee compensation for travel. Prioritize placement of candidates who live closer to the MHMR locations to minimize travel expenses.

medium_risk_items.description: MHMR requires a quick response to requests for temporary workers. The inability to provide a temporary worker by the stated deadline is considered an inability to provide the temporary worker (Section 4.1.17).
medium_risk_items.mitigation: Ensure sufficient recruiter and account manager staff capacity to promptly address staffing requests. Maintain a pool of readily available qualified candidates. Implement systems to efficiently track and manage requests and candidate availability.

medium_risk_items.description: The RFP requires Contractors to conduct background checks on temporary employees, yet MHMR reserves the right to conduct additional background checks, creating a potential overlap and increased cost (Section 4.1.11).
medium_risk_items.mitigation: Align background check processes with MHMR to avoid duplication. Understand their specific requirements. Clearly communicate the background check process to temporary employees.

medium_risk_items.description: Contractor is responsible for the safety, injury, and health of its personnel on MHMR property (Section 4.1.30). This increases workers compensation and liability exposure for RFQXpert.
medium_risk_items.mitigation: Reinforce safety protocols for temporary staff on MHMR premises. Maintain adequate workers' compensation insurance and liability coverage. Conduct regular safety audits and risk assessments.

low_risk_items.description: If a contractor's Hourly Pay Rate to its workers goes down, the lower rate is required to be reported to MHMR and reflected in the contractor's billing rate. This could lead to revenue reduction (Section 4.1.23).
low_risk_items.mitigation: Implement strategies to maintain competitive pay rates. Monitor market trends to anticipate changes in compensation levels. Negotiate rate adjustments with MHMR if necessary.

low_risk_items.description: Temporary workers must return keys, or the Contractor will absorb the cost of replacing locks and/or keys (Section 4.1.31).
low_risk_items.mitigation: Implement a strict key management procedure. Reinforce the importance of key return to temporary employees. Consider electronic access control where possible.

low_risk_items.description: The RFP requires electronic submissions on a flash drive. While this is straightforward, failure to comply with the submission guidelines could result in disqualification.
low_risk_items.mitigation: Double-check formatting requirements before submission. Backup the submission to other locations in case of error.
